thread.title: Should USC give running back Ronald Jones II a bigger role on offense?
thread.title_full: Should USC give running back Ronald Jones II a bigger role on offense?

author: New details show what fueled road-rage killing
title: Should USC give running back Ronald Jones II a bigger role on offense?
text:
Should USC give running back Ronald Jones II a bigger role on offense? FOXSports 17 hrs ago © Jonathan Dyer-USA TODAY Sports Jan 2, 2015; St. Petersburg, FL, USA; Team Highlight running back Ronald Jones II (24) announces his commitment to USC at the 2015 Under Armour All-America Game at Tropicana Field. Mandatory Credit: Jonathan Dyer-USA TODAY Sports
USC freshman running back Ronald Jones II showed his speed vs. Notre Dame, recording a 65-yard run in the second half.
Jones has 380 yards and nearly nine yards per carry through USC's six games, filling in servicably for senior Tre Madden. According to Paolo Uggetti , Jones ranks top ten in the nation for yards per carry. But he's not in the top one hundred for total number of carries. Expect Jones to see more of the workload as the Trojans continue the season.
Ronald Jones II is Top 10 in the nation among RBs in yards per carry. But he's not even in the Top 100 in number of carries. #USC
— Paolo Uggetti (@PaoloUggetti) October 21, 2015 Meanwhile, however, Jones isn't concerned with the amount of play time he's received.
"I'm actually playing more than I thought I would," said Jones, via LA Times . "So I'm really happy with where I'm at."
(h/t LA Times )
